subtitle: These dessert accompaniments are not as difficult to make as you might think - and they are always impressive when entertaining. The baskets make delightful edible containers for ice creams and sorbets.

method.text: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line baking trays with greaseproof paper.

Place butter, sugar and syrup in a pan. Heat gently for 2-3 min, or until melted. (Do not allow the mixture to boil - otherwise it will crystallise.) Remove from heat. Stir in the flour, ginger, brandy and lemon rind until well mixed.
Divide mixture into 10 equal amounts and spoon onto baking trays - about 10 cm apart, to allow for spreading. Bake one tray at a time in the oven for 7-10 min, until bubbling and golden brown.
Meanwhile, lightly grease the oranges and the handles of several wooden spoons.
Remove biscuits from the oven. Leave to cool for 1-2 min - otherwise they will fall apart when being shaped. Loosen with a palette knife.

Roll half the biscuits around the lightly greased spoon handles. Mould the remaining biscuits  over the lightly greased oranges to shape into brandy snap baskets. Leave to cool and set. Finally, carefully remove the snaps and baskets from the spoons and oranges.

title: Brandy snaps and brandy snap baskets
